intro: Angelica lineariloba var. culbertsonii, commonly known as Culbertson's angelica, is a rare and endangered plant species native to the western United States. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, compound leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in an umbel, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and stream banks. Due to habitat loss, it is critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
